title: What CNN saw on the front lines in eastern Ukraine
description: On the frontlines east of the port city of Mariupol, the Ukrainian army's defensive positions look much as they did two years ago: Platoons shelter in improvised bunkers and ruined houses, and trenches curl through the frigid landscape.

title: At least 22 dead in Ecuador landslide
description: At least 22 people have died after heavy rainfall triggered a landslide on Monday in Quito, Ecuador, authorities said.

title: Guinea-Bissau's president says coup attempt has failed
description: The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) has called for peace in Guinea-Bissau, as gunfire was heard around the government palace in the capital Bissau on Tuesday, triggering concerns of a coup.

title: Beijing Olympics 'feels safe' says IOC director
description: IOC Olympic Games Executive Director Christophe Dubi chats with CNN about the atmosphere at the Beijing Winter Olympics, including the diplomatic boycott and designing a "closed-loop" system to balance the zero-Covid policy with the many participants from around the world.

title: FBI to Olympians: Use burner phones in Beijing
McConnell breaks with Trump over his latest vow if he wins the 2024 presidency
description: Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) disagreed with Donald Trump's vow to pardon Jan. 6 rioters, should he return to the White House. CNN's Manu Raju reports.

title: Quebec scraps 'unvaxxed tax', saying it divided people
description: • Denmark lifts all Covid restrictions

title: Amnesty accuses Israel of apartheid over treatment of Palestinians, prompting angry response
description: Amnesty International has become the latest human rights organization to accuse Israel of apartheid for its treatment of Palestinians, prompting an angry response from Israel, which has denounced the report as anti-Semitic.

title: The massive miscalculation Republicans made on the 1/6 committee
description: Last spring, congressional Republicans made two fateful decisions.

title: Russian President didn't offer any solutions to Ukraine crisis, sparked by Russia's massive troop buildup
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said the Russian government was studying the responses from the United States and NATO to Russia's security concerns, but said his country's main concerns "had been ignored."

title: Stunning light display illuminates skies for Lunar New Year
description: China welcomed the Year of the Tiger with an epic light show illuminating the skylines of four cities: Beijing, Wuhan, Chongqing and Qingdao.

title: 'China is facing an economic crisis': Soros on China and Xi Jinping
description: Billionaire investor George Soros warned China's economy, especially the real estate market, is facing a crisis under President Xi Jinping.

title: Tesla recalls all vehicles with 'full self-driving'
description: Tesla will recall all 53,822 vehicles with its "full self-driving" driver-assist feature after it was intentionally programmed to slowly roll through stop signs in some scenarios.

title: Want to win at Wordle? Use these words
description: Wordle has taken over the internet.

title: A record number of Americans quit their jobs in 2021
description: Last year was a historic one for American jobs. A record number of workers quit their jobs while US employers had more positions to fill than ever before.

title: 'We'll never back down': Myanmar's coup, one year later
description: Dr. Sasa, who speaks for the Myanmar opposition, says 'it's not a matter of if, it's a matter of when' the military regime is defeated.

title: Joe Rogan's path from reality host to Covid controversy king
description: If Joe Rogan wasn't already a household name before last week, he almost certainly is now.

title: Police granted more time to question arrested Man United player
description: UK police have been granted more time to continue questioning a man in his 20s -- who is reported to be Manchester United football player Mason Greenwood -- according to a statement by Greater Manchester Police on Tuesday.

title: Whoopi Goldberg apologizes on-air for Holocaust comments
description: After apologizing on social media for her comments about the Holocaust, Whoopi Goldberg opened "The View" on Tuesday by addressing the situation again.

title: 99 million-year-old flowers found perfectly preserved in amber
description: Flowers discovered perfectly preserved in globs of amber bloomed at the feet of dinosaurs, suggesting that some flowering plants in South Africa today have remained unchanged for 99 million years, a new study reveals.

title: Overuse of melatonin as a sleep aid is on the rise, study says. Here's why that's cause for concern
description: More adults are taking over-the-counter melatonin to get to sleep, a new study found, despite potential health harms and little proof of efficacy.  Because of a lack of federal regulations on dosage and purity of the products, many could be absorbing dangerously high levels of the hormone.

title: A TikTok user wrote an entire musical for her Disney-style Korean princess. Now it's going viral
description: After realizing there weren't any Koreans in the pantheon of iconic Disney princesses, 22-year-old Julia Riew set out to create one herself, along with an accompanying musical.

title: From space-age silhouettes to a princess on horseback: 5 highlights from Paris Haute Couture Week
description: French for "high dressmaking," Haute Couture is the most luxurious and highly protected classification of fashion, conceived by an invite-only group of the world's most respected designers.

title: Denmark has lifted all Covid-19 restrictions
description: Denmark has lifted all Covid-19 restrictions within the country, with coronavirus no longer considered a "socially critical sickness," according to the government.

title: Tom Brady officially announces his retirement
Russia says there was a 'mix-up' in its response to US on Ukraine
description: The Kremlin said Tuesday that there had been a "mix-up" over its reply to the United States on the Ukraine crisis, as diplomatic efforts to deter a Russian invasion picked up pace.

title: French lawmakers have proposed a hijab ban in competitive sports. The impact on women could be devastating.
description: Mama Diakité is 23, and has been playing club football for the past 10 years. But all of that could change, she says, if a ban on wearing the hijab while playing sports proposed by the French senate becomes law.

title: How does Russia's army compare with Ukraine's?
description: As tensions mount on the border between Ukraine and Russia, senior analyst Jeffrey Edmonds explains what the military hardware looks like on each side.

title: Moses J. Moseley, 'Walking Dead' actor, dead at 31
description: Moses J. Moseley, who portrayed one of zombies on "The Walking Dead," has died, his talent manager Gail Tassell confirmed to CNN Tuesday.

title: Shocking dashcam footage shows driver firing gun in road rage encounter
description: A driver's dashcam captured the moments leading up to him firing 11 rounds at another driver during a road rage encounter. CNN's Alexandra Field reports.

title: Publisher halts Anne Frank betrayal book amid questions on research
description: A Dutch publisher has suspended printing of a book that suggested a Jewish notary betrayed Anne Frank, saying there were questions about the research behind it, according to an internal email seen by Reuters.

title: The game boosting diversity in esports and creating role models for the next generation
description: Those within esports often get tired with constant comparisons with traditional sports, but the increasingly popular world of competitive gaming can often be an example for those more historic sports to follow.

title: Kanye West really doesn't want to do an NFT right now
description: Ye (formally known as Kanye West) is apparently tired of being asked to do an NFT.

title: Rachel Zegler responds to Snow White casting criticism
description: Actress Rachel Zegler has responded to criticism of her casting as Snow White in an upcoming live-action remake.

title: New York Times buys viral sensation online game 'Wordle'
description: The New York Times has acquired Wordle, the online game that has become a viral sensation. Jonathan Knight, the general manager for Games with the Times says the explosively popular game that gives players six chances to guess a five-letter word daily will remain free, for now.

title: GOP candidate tells voters to 'show up armed' to polls
description: Mike Detmer, a Republican candidate running for Michigan state Senate, was caught on camera at a meet and greet telling voters that people should be ready to "show up armed" to protect Republican ballot observers "if we can't change the tide." CNN's Laura Jarrett reports.

title: Racing speeds with all the luxury. See Aston Martin's DBX707 SUV
description: Aston Martin announced the release a new version of its luxury SUV, the DBX707, that can go from zero to 60 mph in 3.1 seconds. And with everything it packs under the hood, it comes with no small price tag.

title: Retired Boeing jet transformed into $1,300 per hour 'party plane'
description: There are many different places a retired plane can end up in its after life.

title: How Qatar went from regional outcast to key Biden ally
description: Qatar is on its way to becoming a major non-NATO ally of the United States, a sign of its growing relevance to Washington's global agenda.

title: What does snow in Syria look like? The reality might break your heart
description: CNN's Arwa Damon reports on one of the harshest winters to hit Syria in decades and how displaced communities are struggling to survive it.

title: 'I am completely isolated': US Olympic gold medal hopeful tests positive in Beijing
description: American bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor flew to Beijing last week with her sights set on finally winning her first Olympic gold.

title: Dolce & Gabbana to drop animal fur in favor of 'eco' alternative
description: Dolce & Gabbana has joined a growing list of fashion houses to ban animal fur, announcing Monday that it will use a sustainable "eco-fur" in future collections.

title: Christian school asks parents to sign contract that could exclude gay and transgender students
description: A Christian school in the Australian city of Brisbane has sparked outrage for requiring parents to sign an enrollment contract that refers to homosexuality as a sin and includes it in a list of "immoral" behavior alongside bestiality, incest, and pedophilia.

title: Russian state media gets cold shoulder from civilians amid Ukraine tensions
description: As the Kremlin weighs its next moves, the prospect of war doesn't appear to be weighing too heavily on the Russian people. CNN's Nic Robertson reports from Moscow.

title: What it's like to be inside the world's most ambitious quarantine bubble
description: The Beijing Winter Olympics is being hosted inside a veritable fortress -- known informally as the "bubble" -- that takes weeks of careful planning to successfully penetrate.

title: Myanmar residents carry out one of the biggest and most unified resistance movements the country has seen
description: After one year of military rule in Myanmar, millions of people are resisting a return to repression and isolation.

title: Russia lashes out at UK over new sanctions threat
description: Russia has accused Washington of stoking "hysteria" over the crisis on the Ukrainian border, as the US Ambassador to the United Nations warned "the consequences will be horrific" if Russia invades.

title: Lunar New Year 2022: Welcoming the Year of the Tiger
description: Dust off your pink, tiger-print jacket -- it's time to celebrate the Lunar New Year.

title: 'The provocation's from Russia': US has tough words on crisis
description: The United States and Russia ramped up their rhetoric over Ukraine, with both nations trading words at a recent UN Security Council meeting. CNN's Phil Mattingly reports.

title: Exclusive: Trump advisers drafted more than one executive order to seize voting machines, sources tell CNN
description: Former President Donald Trump's advisers drafted two versions of an executive order to seize voting machines -- one directing the Department of Defense to do so and another the Department of Homeland Security -- as part of a broader effort to undermine the 2020 election results, multiple sources tell CNN.

title: 'We Don't Talk About Bruno' is the No. 1 song in America
description: Let's talk about Bruno.

title: Trump team announces $122 million war chest
description: Former President Donald Trump's political organization has amassed $122 million in cash reserves, his team announced Monday. The war chest he has stockpiled is unprecedented for a former President and underscores his financial dominance in Republican politics more than a year after leaving the White House and in the midst of a critical midterm cycle.

title: Some Trump records given to January 6 panel were ripped up
description:
• Trump team announces $122 million war chest
• Exclusive: Trump advisers drafted more than one executive order to seize voting machines, sources tell CNN

title: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau tests positive for Covid-19
description: Canada's Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, has tested positive for Covid-19, he announced Monday.

title: Internet sensation Wordle was just bought for a price 'in the low seven figures'
description: The New York Times has acquired Wordle, the explosively popular game that gives players six chances to guess a five-letter word daily.

title: Ottawa soup kitchen donations roll in after truck protesters allegedly harassed staff
description: An Ottawa soup kitchen has received an outpouring of support after a group of truckers protesting in the city allegedly harassed staff and assaulted a homeless man on Saturday.

title: Judge rejects plea deal for one of Ahmaud Arbery's killers
description: Federal prosecutors have reached plea agreements with Travis McMichael and his father, Gregory McMichael, on hate crime charges they faced in the murder of Ahmaud Arbery, court documents show.

title: Moscow's written response comes ahead of a planned phone call between US Secretary of State Blinken and Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov
description: The US Ambassador to the United Nations declared Monday that Russia "didn't give us the answers that any of us would've hoped that they would provide" after a tense United Nations Security Council meeting over Moscow's escalation along the border with Ukraine ended in a standoff.
